item.title: 土耳其中央银行将利率降至 38
item.description: 在 11 月份通胀数据良好之后，土耳其央行连续第四次下调利率。【原文：Turkey’s central bank cut interest rates for the fourth time in a row, following favorable inflation data in November.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州石油开采产生的有毒水将被处理后泵入河流
item.description:
州环境监管机构正在评估四家公司向佩科斯河排放经过处理的二叠纪盆地废水的申请

。【原文：

State environmental regulators are evaluating applications from four companies to release treated Permian Basin wastewater into the Pecos River

】

item.title: 公司现在才开始统计美国停摆的影响
item.description: 虽然美国历史上持续时间最长的政府关门已经结束，但 43 天的僵局对美国和其他国家的公司造成的影响才刚刚开始。【原文：While the longest government shutdown in US history is over, the consequences of the 43-day impasse are only just starting to feed through for companies across the US and beyond.】

item.title: 英国央行行长看到人工智能开始促进经济发展的迹象
item.description: 英格兰银行行长表示，有早期迹象表明，人工智能正开始兑现其作为一种提高生产力的技术的承诺。【原文：There are early signs that artificial intelligence is starting to deliver on its promise as a technology that boosts productivity, according to the Bank of England Governor.】

item.title: 伯恩斯坦称莱茵金属股价接近熊市
item.description: 为数不多的不看好德国坦克和弹药制造商莱茵金属公司（Rheinmetall AG）的分析师之一已经抛出了橄榄枝，称最近的下跌已经让该股的交易 "接近熊市"。【原文：One of the few analysts without a bullish stance on German tank and ammunition maker Rheinmetall AG has thrown in the towel, saying recent declines have left the stock trading “close to a bear case.”】

item.title: 研究发现：大多数南非人希望结束授权政策
item.description: 正义与和解研究所（Institute for Justice and Reconciliation）的数据显示，超过半数的南非人希望废除一项旨在解决种族不平等问题的重要政策，并希望在招聘和晋升时任人唯贤。【原文：More than half of South Africans want a key policy aimed at addressing racial inequality scrapped and hiring and promotions to be merit-based, according to the Institute for Justice and Reconciliation.】

item.title: 微软印度裔首席执行官开发自己的板球应用程序
item.description: 微软公司的萨蒂亚-纳德拉（Satya Nadella）是板球的铁杆粉丝，他一直在利用业余时间编码和设计自己的应用程序，用来分析这项有几百年历史的运动。【原文：Microsoft Corp.’s Satya Nadella, a die-hard cricket fan, has been spending his free time coding and designing his own app that he used to analyze the centuries-old game.】

item.title: 投资者转向 "被过度憎恨、权重过低 "的能源股
item.description: 科技股的轮动终于让投资者开始关注市场上最不受青睐的一个角落：能源生产商。【原文：The rotation from technology stocks has investors, at long last, scouring one of the least loved corners of the market: energy producers.】

item.title: OpenAI和微软因ChatGPT谋杀案而被起诉
item.description: OpenAI 及其投资方微软公司因康涅狄格州的一起谋杀-自杀案而被起诉，这是最近一起指责流行的 ChatGPT 聊天机器人对用户进行危险的心理操纵的案件。【原文：OpenAI and its investor Microsoft were sued over a Connecticut murder-suicide in the latest case to blame the popular ChatGPT chatbot for dangerous psychological manipulation of users.】

item.title: 美银美林警告盈利增长风险，爱尔康获得罕见的 "卖出 "评级
item.description: 在美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）双双下调爱尔康股票评级后，瑞士眼科护理专家爱尔康公司自 8 月份以来首次被分析师看跌，该公司警告说，新眼科手术机器的推广速度放缓将给利润增长带来压力。【原文：Alcon Inc., the Swiss eye-care specialist, got its first bearish mark from analysts since August after Bank of America Corp. double downgraded the stock, warning that a slower rollout of its new eye-surgery machines will pressure profit growth.】

item.title: 挪威银行调查显示经济增长放缓，支持进一步削减开支
item.description: 对挪威商业景气的一项重要调查显示，这个北欧国家可能面临经济复苏放缓的局面，这为挪威央行缩短宽松货币政策的休止期提供了更充分的理由。【原文：A key survey of Norway’s business sentiment showed the Nordic nation may face a slower economic recovery, strengthening the case for its central bank to shorten its planned break from monetary easing.】

item.title: 危机加深，中国誓言稳定房地产市场
item.description: 中国政策制定者在一次重要的经济会议上承诺加大力度稳定房地产市场，重申了去年出台的政策，但没有采取一些经济学家认为振兴房地产行业所需的措施。【原文：Chinese policymakers pledged to intensify their efforts to stabilize the housing market at a key economic meeting, reaffirming policies issued last year but stopping short of the measures some economists think are needed to revive the sector.】

item.title: 欧洲央行概述明年减轻银行监管负担的计划
item.description: 欧洲中央银行明年将颁布一系列改革措施，使其对贷款机构的监管更加有效，并降低行业成本。【原文：The European Central Bank will enact a raft of changes next year to make its supervision of lenders more effective and reduce costs for the industry.】

item.title: 中国启动降息，誓言实施更加积极的财政政策
item.description: 中国经济政策制定者承诺采取支持性货币和财政政策，暗示将在 2025 年底经济增长势头减弱时降息并增加可观的预算赤字。【原文：China‘s economic policymakers pledged to adopt supportive monetary and fiscal policy, hinting at interest rate cuts and a sizable budget deficit as the economy’s momentum weakened toward the end of 2025.】

item.title: 投资者关注美联储即将推出的票据购买计划，国债持平
item.description: 国债在经历了三周以来的最大涨幅后持稳，投资者为美联储周五开始每月购买 400 亿美元的国债做好了准备。【原文：Treasuries were steady following the biggest rally in three weeks, with investors preparing for the Federal Reserve to start buying $40 billion of bills per month on Friday.】

item.title: 葡萄牙准备支持森特诺竞选欧洲央行副行长一职
item.description: 据葡萄牙财政部长称，葡萄牙前央行行长马里奥-森特诺（Mario Centeno）是欧洲中央银行下一任副行长的潜在竞争者。【原文：Portugal’s former central-bank Governor Mario Centeno is a potential contender to become the European Central Bank’s next vice president, according to the country’s finance minister.】

item.title: 旅游业蓬勃发展，南非商业情绪飙升至 14 年新高
item.description: 受旅游业蓬勃发展的推动，11 月份南非商业信心飙升至 2011 年以来的最高水平。【原文：South African business confidence surged to its highest level since 2011 in November, boosted by a tourism boom.】

item.title: 前花旗集团双雄的对冲基金 Ilex 资产增至 70 亿美元
item.description: Ilex Capital Partners 是近年来伦敦最大的对冲基金初创公司之一，经过资本募集和业绩增长，其管理的资金已增至 70 亿美元。【原文：Ilex Capital Partners, one of the biggest hedge fund startups in London in recent years, has grown to manage $7 billion after a capital raise and performance gains.】

item.title: Equinor 与合作伙伴斥资 4 亿美元增加 Castberg 油桶储量
item.description: 挪威埃奎诺公司（Equinor ASA）及其合作伙伴将斥资40亿克朗（约合4亿美元）增加巴伦支海约翰卡斯特伯格油田的产量，因为这家挪威公司正努力扩大其最新生产中心的高原产量。【原文：Equinor ASA and partners will spend 4 billion kroner ($400 million) to boost barrels coming from the Johan Castberg oil field in the Barents Sea, as the Norwegian company seeks to extend plateau production from its newest production hub.】

item.title: 印度央行在 5 月以来的首次拍卖中购买 55 亿美元债券
item.description: 印度央行按计划购买了 5000 亿卢比（55 亿美元）的债券，以增加银行系统的流动性。【原文：India’s central bank bought 500 billion rupees ($5.5 billion) of bonds, as planned, as it seeks to boost liquidity in the banking system.】

item.title: 捷克决策者警告 2026 年加息赌注可能为时过早
item.description: 捷克央行行长扬-库比切克（Jan Kubicek）表示，捷克利率上调的可能性大于下调，但明年加息的预期可能为时过早。【原文：Czech interest rates are more likely to increase than decline, though expectations of a hike next year may be premature, according to central banker Jan Kubicek.】

item.title: 欧洲央行拟调整银行 AT1 资本以更好地吸收损失
item.description: 欧洲中央银行建议改变贷款人发行的一种深度次级债券的设计，以确保它能在银行倒闭前吸收损失。【原文：The European Central Bank proposed changing the design of a type of deeply subordinated bond issued by lenders to ensure it can absorb losses before banks fail.】

item.title: 国际能源署自五月以来首次下调石油供应过剩创纪录的预测
item.description: 随着需求增强和产量增长放缓，国际能源机构数月来首次下调了今明两年全球石油供应过剩的预期。【原文：The International Energy Agency trimmed estimates for a global oil supply surplus this year and next for the first time in several months as demand strengthens and output growth slows.】

item.title: 乌克兰袭击俄罗斯海上油田，局势进一步升级
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士称，乌克兰袭击了卢克石油公司（Lukoil PJSC）位于里海的菲拉诺夫斯基油田，扩大了其对俄罗斯能源基础设施的袭击范围，而此时乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）正面临美国的压力，要求其同意主要按照克里姆林宫的条件达成和平协议。【原文：Ukraine attacked Lukoil PJSC’s Filanovsky oil field in the Caspian Sea, according to a person familiar the matter, widening the scope of its strikes on Russian energy infrastructure just as President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is under US pressure to agree to a peace deal largely on the Kremlin’s terms.】

item.title: 瑞士国家银行维持零利率，下调通胀预期
item.description: 瑞士国家银行将利率维持在零，认为通胀前景的疲软还不能证明恢复负借贷成本是合理的。【原文：The Swiss National Bank kept its interest rate at zero, judging that a weakened inflation outlook doesn’t yet justify a return to negative borrowing costs.】

item.title: 这份国家安全战略并非为欧洲而写
item.description:
在本期特朗普经济学节目中，我们将解释一份措辞直白的文件是如何让外国首都大为光火的，而这份文件很可能是针对特朗普的 基本盘的。【原文：

On this episode of Trumponomics, we explain how a bluntly worded document that has foreign capitals up in arms was probably aimed at Trump’s base.

】

item.title: 中国官员与 PDD 工作人员在审计期间发生争执
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，上周，PDD 控股公司的员工与在该电子商务公司上海办公场所进行检查的中国监管机构至少发生了两起斗殴事件。【原文：At least two fistfights broke out last week between PDD Holdings Inc. employees and Chinese regulators who were performing checks at the e-commerce company’s Shanghai premises, according to people familiar with the matter.】
